headline.seo: Sex Education for Teenagers, Online and in Texts

headline.print_headline: Sex Education Gets Directly to Youths, Via Text

docs.abstract: Some health organizations and school districts are developing cost-effective sex education Web sites and text services to reach teenagers; many services offer both privacy and communities where adolescents can learn about sexuality and relationships, particularly on mobile devices.

docs.lead_paragraph: New TV shows are liable to pop up any time these days, but over the last few years January has solidified its position as the start of television's second season. There are probably more series making their debuts or having their season premieres next month than there were during the official start of the 2011-12 broadcast network season in September. A quick scan turns up more than 70. The January premieres are a motley, cable-dominated bunch, including a reality show about taxidermy and the fifth season of ''Jersey Shore.'' But that also makes them a more vibrant collection than the fall's dire crop of new and returning network shows. And there are a few high-toned productions sprinkled in, like the new season of ''Downton Abbey'' and Dustin Hoffman's first appearance as a TV-series regular in HBO's ''Luck.''

headline.main: A Second Chance For TV's Season
